title: RPC `debug_traceTransaction` user provided javascript tracer code causes method handler crashes due to go panics
body:
Hi there,

as mentioned 2 weeks ago I finally found some time to debug and file the crashes @holiman. Here are the details.

There are multiple opportunities for a user with access to the `debug_traceTransaction` endpoint to crash the remote method handler by providing javascript code that causes the handler to panic. 

Please note that the node recovers from this error (goroutine -> recover ðŸ™Œ). 

See test-cases below.

**Note** Even though the `debug` RPC namespace implies that critical functionality can be accessed I'd recommend adding a note to the `debug_traceTransaction` documentation that clearly outlines the risk of allowing untrusted entities to run untrusted javascript code especially because the interpreter engine is a native C library (duktape) which does not have the memory safety guarantees go provides (vulnerability in duktape).

#### System information

release and latest master. any os.

Geth version: `Geth/v1.9.11-unstable-3c776c71-20200131/darwin-amd64/go1.13.6`
OS & Version: OSX
Commit hash : `15d09038a6b1d533bc78662f2f0b77ccf03aaab0`

#### Expected behaviour

method handler should not crash.

#### Actual behaviour

```json
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 1,
    "error": {
        "code": -32000,
        "message": "method handler crashed"
    }
}
```

#### quick check

```console
//start
geth --rpc --gcmode=archive --syncmode=full  --rpcapi eth,web3,debug,admin

INFO [01-31|14:33:57.470] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/v1.9.11-unstable-3c776c71-20200131/darwin-amd64/go1.13.6
```
```json
//REQ
{
    "id": 1,
    "method": "debug_traceTransaction",
    "params": [
        "0xa56249d3ca83cd8ba2e48e3c02532c4ef94f0024004f6332cff00526a3c7de6e",
        {
            "tracer": "{depths: [],step: function(log, db) {this.depths.push(log.memory.getUint(-100000));},fault: function() {},result: function() { return this.depths; }}"
        }
    ]
}
//RESP
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 1,
    "error": {
        "code": -32000,
        "message": "method handler crashed"
    }
}
```


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

##### Slice(negative, negative) or Slice(negative, >=mw.memory.Len()) panic

**code:** 

**Note**: see `@note` comments

https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/eth/tracers/tracer.go#L94

```go

// slice returns the requested range of memory as a byte slice.
func (mw *memoryWrapper) slice(begin, end int64) []byte {
	if mw.memory.Len() < int(end) {
		// TODO(karalabe): We can't js-throw from Go inside duktape inside Go. The Go
		// runtime goes belly up https://github.com/golang/go/issues/15639.
		log.Warn("Tracer accessed out of bound memory", "available", mw.memory.Len(), "offset", begin, "size", end-begin)
		return nil  //@note - panics later at ptr := ctx.PushFixedBuffer(len(blob)) 
	}
	return mw.memory.GetCopy(begin, end-begin)  //@note - panic (-1, -2)
}

[...]

// pushObject assembles a JSVM object wrapping a swappable memory and pushes it
// onto the VM stack.
func (mw *memoryWrapper) pushObject(vm *duktape.Context) {
	obj := vm.PushObject()

	// Generate the `slice` method which takes two ints and returns a buffer
	vm.PushGoFunction(func(ctx *duktape.Context) int {
		blob := mw.slice(int64(ctx.GetInt(-2)), int64(ctx.GetInt(-1)))
		ctx.Pop2()

		ptr := ctx.PushFixedBuffer(len(blob))  //@note - panics if blob is nil
		copy(makeSlice(ptr, uint(len(blob))), blob)
		return 1
	})
	vm.PutPropString(obj, "slice")

	// Generate the `getUint` method which takes an int and returns a bigint
	vm.PushGoFunction(func(ctx *duktape.Context) int {
		offset := int64(ctx.GetInt(-1))
		ctx.Pop()

		pushBigInt(mw.getUint(offset), ctx)
		return 1
	})
	vm.PutPropString(obj, "getUint")
}
```

**testcase:** 
```javascript
{depths: [], step: function(log) { this.depths.push(log.memory.slice(-1,-2)); }, fault: function() {}, result: function() { return this.depths; }}
```



##### getUint(<=-32) panic

**code:** 

**Note**: see `@note` comments

https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/eth/tracers/tracer.go#L105

```go
// getUint returns the 32 bytes at the specified address interpreted as a uint.
func (mw *memoryWrapper) getUint(addr int64) *big.Int {
	if mw.memory.Len() < int(addr)+32 {  //@note - panic addr <= -32
		// TODO(karalabe): We can't js-throw from Go inside duktape inside Go. The Go
		// runtime goes belly up https://github.com/golang/go/issues/15639.
		log.Warn("Tracer accessed out of bound memory", "available", mw.memory.Len(), "offset", addr, "size", 32)
		return new(big.Int)
	}
	return new(big.Int).SetBytes(mw.memory.GetPtr(addr, 32))
}
```

**testcase:** 
```javascript
{ depths: [], step: function(log, db) { this.depths.push(log.memory.getUint(-64));}, fault: function() {}, result: function() { return this.depths; }}
```

##### peek(negative) panic

**code:** 

**Note**: see `@note` comments

https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/eth/tracers/tracer.go#L148

```go

// peek returns the nth-from-the-top element of the stack.
func (sw *stackWrapper) peek(idx int) *big.Int {
	if len(sw.stack.Data()) <= idx {  //@note - panic if idx is negative
		// TODO(karalabe): We can't js-throw from Go inside duktape inside Go. The Go
		// runtime goes belly up https://github.com/golang/go/issues/15639.
		log.Warn("Tracer accessed out of bound stack", "size", len(sw.stack.Data()), "index", idx)
		return new(big.Int)
	}
	return sw.stack.Data()[len(sw.stack.Data())-idx-1]
}

```

**testcase:** 
```javascript
{depths: [], step: function(log) { this.depths.push(log.stack.peek(-1)); }, fault: function() {}, result: function() { return this.depths; }}
```

It seems #20612 fixes this issue. Can you confirm?
I assume this issue has been fixed. If the problem persists, please open a new issue.
